Atrial Fibrillation Classification and Amiodarone Use at 12 Months.
Discussion
In the CASTLE-HTx trial, we found that catheter ablation of atrial fibrillation plus medical therapy in patients with end-stage heart failure who were referred for transplantation evaluation was associated with a lower likelihood of a composite of death from any cause, implantation of a left ventricular assist device, or urgent heart transplantation than medical therapy alone. Fewer deaths from any cause and implantations of a left ventricular assist device occurred among the patients who received catheter ablation than among those who received medical therapy alone. There were few, minor adverse events related to catheter ablation.
